attributes.action: Make Daventry District Council (DDC) into a Unitary Authority
attributes.background: Under the proposed arrangements, decisions in the District will be taken by a council of which a majority of members represent the urban areas of Northampton. Let DDC become a unitary authority: keep democracy local.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/northamptonshire-county-council-best-value-inspection

"Sajid Javid orders probe into country council's finances" - BBC 9 January 2018

"Tory authority becomes first UK council in 20 years to impose emergency spending ban" - Daily Telegraph 3 February 2018

"Northamptonshire County Council backs £40m budget cuts" - BBC 28 February 2018

"Auditor criticises Northants County Council in damming new report" - Northants Telegraph 22 May 2018

attributes.action: Get Student Finance England to consider a mortgage as ‘financial independence’.
attributes.background: Currently, the regulations for an individual applying for Student Finance under the age of 25, must be assessed on their parental household income, unless married or care for a child. However, SFE do not view a mortgage to be an eligble factor to verify “independent status”.
attributes.additional_details: After several appeals to review my circumstances, SFE have rejected my request for “independent status”. As a home-owner, unemployment with little student loan to pay my mortgage for the year whilst studying, has resulted in withdrawal from my course. It is suggested to marry to be considered as “financially independent” to therefore receive finance based on my own income rather than my parents. It is an outdated system to consider marriage as more financially independent, than owning a home.

attributes.action: Legalise a new class of light electric vehicles
attributes.background: Living in a big city, getting around is a major consideration. Public transport is overcrowded, dirty and often inconvenient. Private vehicles are unaffordable and inconvenient. As the UK invests in infrastructure for the alternative, cycling, PEVs which could utilise this continue to be outlawed.
attributes.additional_details:
As many other countries already do, the UK should embrace the existence of Personal Electric Vehicles (PEVs).

These are small electrically propelled vehicles such as scooters which reach similar speeds to a bicycle with a range of around 20 miles, and unlike bikes are practical enough to be handled like a suitcase when not in use.

With similar regards to electric bikes, legalising PEVs will offer an added green alternative for transportation and allow individuals improved freedom of movement.

attributes.action: Mental Health assessment and treatment, waiting times, published by October 2018
attributes.background: DOH is not directing its associated bodies, to present the waiting lists for public scrutiny and recognise. The waiting list is often over 18 months or longer. The data is easily collected and can be provided and we do not need to wait until April 2019 as promised it can be done ASAP.
attributes.additional_details: Autism services are an example, though the problem is across all services: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-44874939 another example of Students waiting for IAPT services: https://thebristolcable.org/2018/07/bristol-university-mental-health-suicide-students/

attributes.action: Legislate to give wheelchair users priority access to bus wheelchair spaces
attributes.background:
Wheelchair users do not have lawful priority over other passengers for access to designated wheelchair spaces/bays on public buses.

There have been frequent and media reported cases of such persons being able to travel as other passengers refused to move. Legislation is required to address this.
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike passenger railway systems, persons in wheelchairs do not have priority access to wheelchair spaces provided on buses, despite this being the only safe space for a person in a wheelchair to travel.

Despite the recent Supreme Court case brought by Doug Paulley, bus drivers have no legal power to force other passengers to move, and can still only request that they do so.

This is detrimental to any person in a wheelchair and has a significant impact on travel.

attributes.action: Make it a legal right for on duty ambulances to use bus lanes.
attributes.background:
It is apparent that NHS Trusts are being fined when Ambulances use bus lanes.

It should be legal for all on duty ambulances to use bus lanes, this will increase productivity and reduce costs for our already hard pressed NHS
attributes.additional_details: NHS Trust in Birmingham being fined up to £900 per day

attributes.action: Make it illegal to print information of a death U'18 without parental consent.
attributes.background: Michael, 17 years old, took his own life. Yet in the coroners inquest the press were allowed to hear every detail and print their own interpretation of the events and outcome of the inquest. Although in their article it was miss worded and irrelevant. Causing further grief to the family.
attributes.additional_details: This caused more grief for the family, with the press printing irrelevant information leading up to the events. It was confirmed by the coroner that Michael Nicholas, 17, took his own life on his own accord under no other influence. Although substances were found in the body. The press released information to make the public and readers think otherwise with their unneeded wording and wrong information. Due to their own take on events an article was released to the public and Mikey's friends and family.

attributes.action: Stop the use of Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources (child spies).
attributes.background: Currently Juvenile CHIS (child spies) can be used to gather information to do with offences such as gang violence, drug offences and child sexual exploitation. They can be authorised for covert activity for up to one month which the government is trying to increase to 4 months.
attributes.additional_details: The Home office has given no numbers of how many child spies are used, how the risk assessments are carried out and whether the handlers are trained to assess juvenile mental health. The capacity for children to consent to being spies is dubious given they must feel under pressure from an authority figure (the police force) and are vulnerable in a dangerous situation. Refer to 35th Report of Session 2017-2019 of the House of Lords Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee.

attributes.action: Change the rules for the housing element part of universal credit.
attributes.background:
I am a social landlord who is being affected by the poorly thought out rules for the housing element part of universal credit.
The system was fine under the local councils but so far Universal credit has cost me over 30 weeks in unpaid rent.
Problems for over a year plus now not acceptable!
attributes.additional_details:
Rules that need to be changed ASAP:
1/ Only one office to contact - every time you call you get through to a different centre.
There is no hierarchy chain so you don't get far and there is no accountability.
2/ Speed up call waiting times - 20-30 minutes is too much.
3/ Allow landlords to have the option of being paid directly as standard if they require it.
4/ One journal entry giving landlord permission to access information rather then new journal every time as we don't always live close by.

attributes.action: DEFRA support Farmers Transitioning to Arable Farming
attributes.background: To help and support Farmers Transitioning from Animal Agriculture to Arable Farming

attributes.action: Grant Bees legal protection under The Animal Welfare Act 2006.
attributes.background: We have over 250 species of Bee in the UK, all playing a role in our eco-system, food chain and agricultural success. Since the 1980's the Bee population has declined, which, if left to continue will have an untold impact on the mental, physical and economical welfare of everyone in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Under the Animal Welfare Act 2006 an animal is only granted legal protection if it is a Vertebrate. This leaves Bees with very little in the way of physical or environmental protection.
Classing Bees as a species to be protected under the AWA 2006, means better action against those who threaten the population, whether they be individuals or industries, in the long term providing a better quality of life for us as a species, as well as the numerous native species we share our country with.

attributes.action: Tougher sentences for pedophiles and sharing images of child pornography
attributes.background:
We want tougher sentences for pedophiles and the sharing and owning of images of porn a graphic material of children.

Children who suffer abuse are affected in the worst way possible. They don't get to do a sentence then it's all over, they are sentenced to life!
attributes.additional_details: We need to protect our children and break the cycle of abuse by harsh sentences and strict monitoring. At the moment pedophiles get short sentences and probation. This does not deter them from further abusing children.  A child's innocence and trust is gone forever. Their veiw of the world and adults changes in that moment and they'll never ever really feel safe again. Our view of the world is shaped by our early experiences. 25 to Life imprisonment is the only solution to protect our children and stop abuse.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all schools in England to teach fire safety awareness.
attributes.background: Fires cause death and devastation in homes. This highlights the need to educate all children about fire safety awareness in the home. This would help to reduce fires and save lives.
attributes.additional_details: Our Citizenship class decided that something must be done to help people. By making it mandatory for schools in England to teach fire safety awareness in the home, this may help to stop others from losing their lives.

attributes.action: Secretary of State for Northern Ireland should call a Border Poll on Irish unity
attributes.background: The Good Friday Agreement states that the Secretary of State for Northern Ireland must call a border poll on Irish unity if at any time it appears likely that a majority of those voting would express a wish that Northern Ireland should cease to be part of the UK and form part of a united Ireland.
attributes.additional_details:
Unfortunately the Good Friday Agreement does not state exactly how the SoS will judge the wishes of the majority.

We believe the question needs put to the people of NI so either way the discussion can be put to bed.

attributes.action: Require the prominent labelling of palm oil on all products sold in the UK
attributes.background: Palm oil plantations are a major reason of huge tracts of rainforest destroyed every day. Endangered species are being pushed towards extinction. Companies know that Palm oil is becoming well known as a problem ingredient and hide the product under dozens of different names making it hard to avoid.
attributes.additional_details: www.travelfordifference.com/list-palm-oil-free-products/

attributes.action: Increased funding for the police for dealing with anti-social behaviour.
attributes.background: As part of my Active Citizenship coursework I am taking action in my local area to reduce crime and make it a safer place.

attributes.action: Put up a statue of Margaret Thatcher outside Parliament
attributes.background: Caroline Criado Perez launched an online petition in 2016 after noticing there were no statues of women outside Parliament. There is no better example of a woman than Margaret Thatcher, the first female prime minister of the UK of nearly 12 years.

attributes.action: Increase the defence budget and take the money from foreign aid.
attributes.background: The uk government spends £14 billion a year on foreign aid to nuclear capable nations such as India and Pakistan now it is clear they do not need it and so by giving the military that money they could invest in new ships, tanks and planes and stop the hollowing out of our once proud armed forces.

attributes.action: The Government must publish its own Brexit Impact/Risk Assessments
attributes.background: We are heading towards the end of the A50 period and only 6% of MPs have read them. On that basis they can't be that important or hinder the negotiations, therefore releasing them to the public won't be a problem.
attributes.additional_details: This was previously debated but times have changed.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to charge a single room supplement
attributes.background: This is a petition to ask parliament to make it illegal for hoteliers and tour operators to apply a surcharge to the hotel or holiday booking of anyone travelling on their own. It is routine in the travel industry for a holidaymaker to pay a supplement for occupying a single-bedded hotel room.
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken with several people who often have to travel on their own, many of them believing the supplement to be unfair and unnecessary, especially as there is usually nothing special about the single rooms they are allocated. In my experience, there isn't usually anything exceptional offered in the single room which one could say would attract a surcharge. The rooms are usually tiny, with neither room to "swing a cat", nor a particularly special view outside the window. If you agree that single travellers face unfair discrimination, please sign the petition.

attributes.action: Grant President Donald Trump a full State Visit
attributes.background:
Following President Trump's recent successful visit to our country, the next step should be to allow him the privilege of a full State Visit.

President Trump is the democratically elected President	& as such should be treated with the respect his position holds
attributes.additional_details: We the people of the UK request that President Trump is invited to the UK, given a full state visit, he should also be given the honour of addressing Parliament and the people of the UK.

attributes.action: Law enforced discouragement pop-up on harmful mental health behaviour websites.
attributes.background: From personal experience, we know how access to certain websites can trigger the encouragement to engage in harmful behaviours related to diagnosed, or undiagnosed mental health conditions. We want a pop-up to be introduced that discourages people from posting content or viewing the website further.
attributes.additional_details: There have been multiple studies that show the effects of viewing harmful websites such as pro eating disorder, pro self harm and pro suicide. Many list that the participants experienced lower levels of self-esteem, more willingness to engage in activities being encouraged and distorted perception of self. We believe that discouraging engagement and signposting to support would prevent individuals from being negatively affected by these websites.

attributes.action: Stop animals being used for street entertainment in order to gain money
attributes.background:
Animals are being used by buskers to gain money should be banned!
Animals are being abused, and treated cruelly
Any animal being used for street entertainment should be jailed and dogs siezed
attributes.additional_details: Dogs have been siezed by the rspca for abuse, ill health over the past two years already 17 dogs have been siezed, some through heat exhaustion, urine infections due to not being allowed to pee in the same place, they are wacked by their leads, water bowls are for show only, they are beaten back at base and also drugged this is no life for any animal, this has to stop!!

attributes.action: Make all trespassing a criminal offence
attributes.background: There has been an uplift of illegal encampments in UK. Recently my council has had to pay out more than one hundred thousand pounds in clean up fees. Trespassers do not respond to civil rulings. To give the police more powers, I propose that all trespassing be made a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details:
People cannot dictate where they can live by simply by squatting on land they do not own. Police need powers so owners can be protected.

-100K of clean-up from Milton Keynes Council 
-Reported attacks to Police 
-Closing of School sports days https://www.miltonkeynes.co.uk/news/milton-keynes-primary-school-forced-to-cancel-sports-day-after-illegal-travellers-camp-on-field-1-8540123 
https://www.miltonkeynes.co.uk/news/illegal-travellers-camps-causing-problems-in-milton-keynes-1-8524022

attributes.action: Parent and Child Parking Badge
attributes.background: There are motorists out there that park in parent and child parking spaces when they don't have children, then there is no spaces for those motorists that the are designed for.
attributes.additional_details: There should be a parking badge created for mortorists that are parents to be able to park in the parent & child spaces, working in the same way as the disabled badges. If a motorist wants one they should provide proof they have children (under 12 ) and they drive a car. The badge must have the license plate on so it can't be fraudaulantly used by anyone else. The government should create such a badge which must be renewed every time you get a new car.

attributes.action: The Government make immediate preparations and employ more border personnel
attributes.background: That the Government must not delay any longer and must immediately hire more personnel, for customs and border security and be ready for brexit in March 2019. We were promised contol of our borders yet so far we have not seen evidence that any preparation has been made

attributes.action: Make Asthma inhalers free, like other medicines are for other ailments
attributes.background: As seen in the news people including children die from Asthma attacks.
attributes.additional_details: I know a few people and as seen on the news people of all ages are dying from Asthma attacks. Not everyone uses preventative inhalers due to the prescription costs. Why do diabetics get free prescriptions and other illnesses that can't be helped, but not asthma sufferers? This is a killer and inhalers should be free.

attributes.action: Jacob’s Law: compulsory free internal organ scanning for 0-3 year olds
attributes.background: Routine free internal organ scanning/screenings for 0-3 year olds needed to ensure that those at risk of diseases, like Chronic Kidney Disease, are picked up and treated as early as possible.
attributes.additional_details: To include the main bodily organs like the kidneys, lungs, heart, brain, stomach, bowels, intestines, liver, etc. Many people develop complications with their organs, which could have been detected from birth. Jacob’s Law will encourage vital screening and ensure treatment is administered at the earliest diagnostic point.

attributes.action: Grant Tier 1 General Applicants ILR After 5 Years Continuous Legal Stay In UK
attributes.background: Tier 1 general migrants are experiencing great unfairness and inhumane treatment from the Home Office. Many have been criminalized or turned into illegal immigrants by the hostile immigration rules. With the program wrapped up on 6 April 2018, many in this category have been adversely affected.
attributes.additional_details:
Home Office base refusal decisions for leave to remain on unfair premises such as failing genuine income test even when tax has been paid on such income or citing minor tax errors. Most of these decisions cannot be subject to reasonable challenge due to the black letter law of the Point Based System introduced in 2014 that implicitly confers absolute power on decision makers.

Tier 1 migrants took legal route offered by the UK in migrating here, it is morally unfair to deny them their rights.

attributes.action: Treat knife crime as a health issue, to tackle the current epidemic in London.
attributes.background: Treating knife crime as a health issue is credited with prompting a dramatic drop in stabbings in Scotland, with the decline most pronounced in Glasgow, a city that once had one of the highest murder rates in western Europe.

attributes.action: Inquiries into rape, abuse and systematic grooming of children be independent
attributes.background: For at least forty five years, in many of our cities and towns, rape and sexual abuse of children has been ongoing and systematic. Regular reports have been made to all official capacities in those places without effect or action taken by them. It is not felt internal inquiry would be efficacious
attributes.additional_details:
In addition to the inquiry committee being fully independent, the panel should comprise of at least four of the affected parents from each city and town and in a fully paid participant capacity for the duration of the inquiry.

That those parents be rotated each week and afforded FULL police security before, during and after inquiries as necessary.

That employers consider any time away from jobs in the same way as Jury Duty

attributes.action: Make gcse exams free for all children under 18, including home educated children
attributes.background: Currently, parents/carers of home educated children must pay around £200 per GCSE subject that their child wishes to sit exams for (including exam board and exam centre fees). This actively discriminates against home educated children and should be funded by the government.
attributes.additional_details: Children and parents sometimes choose home education due to disabilities or vulnerability (for example, due to psychological issues caused by bullying brought about as a result of the main stream schooling system). As well as discriminating against home education, forcing parents/carers to pay for gcse exams out of their own pocket may result in gcse qualifications becoming less accessible to vulnerable children. This also risks certain disabled children starting life with fewer qualifications.

attributes.action: Put young offenders in prison for knife crime
attributes.background: The law for sentencing needs to be updated. People convicted of crimes involving knives should go to prison no matter what their age. They should not be allowed out on the streets if found guilty.
attributes.additional_details: There was a case recently where the defendant was under 18 and pleaded guilty to stabbing someone. There was also video evidence that the defendant had broken his court bail conditions. He just got reminded of his bail conditions - nothing else. He wasn’t sentenced to prison, even though he could have killed someone.

attributes.action: Revoke journalist Lauren Southern's ban from the United Kingdom.
attributes.background:
Lauren Southern is a right-wing Canadian journalist who has been banned from entering the UK by the UK Home Office. 
Whilst she does hold views that are deemed controversial, the decision to ban her is unprincipled, immoral, and an anti-productive way to go about dismantling racism.
attributes.additional_details:
Lauren Southern is a Canadian born journalist who rose to fame online when she held up a sign explaining why she does not identify as a feminist. 
Since that photograph, she went on to work for the right-wing media outlet 'Rebel Media', which she has since left to pursue a career as an independent journalist/YouTube personality.

attributes.action: Provide funding for Amputee Football in the UK.
attributes.background: The England Amputee Football Association's aim is to provide all amputees, people with congenital limb deficiencies and persons with restricted use of limbs, with the opportunity to play football locally, nationally and internationally. However, players must raise funds to cover the costs of this.
attributes.additional_details: Amputee football is a fascinating sport to watch. My husband, Darren has been an amputee for 10 years and by being part of a team of amazing and inspirational people, as well as the volunteers who provide physio and coaching, means that he can respresent his country playing the sport that he’s always loved. All players must fundraise and donate to the charity in order to be able to participate in training and tournaments. This sport has the potential to be one of the best in the UK.

attributes.action: Parliament to change the law regarding council tax
attributes.background:
Parliament to change the law, so that local councils can't increase council tax by more than inflation. 
Most people in the UK do not get a wage increase more than the rate of inflation and therefore can't afford a council tax rise of 5%.

attributes.action: Change the law to recognise Domestic Abuse as a crime in its own right
attributes.background: Currently if a victim goes to the police to report Domestic Abuse it will often be classed as Common Assualt which has to be reported within 6 months or action cannot be taken. Many victims do not have the confidence or courage to come forward within the timescale required by law.
attributes.additional_details: The laws relating to domestic abuse are outdated. Many victims do not have the confidence to talk about their abuse for many years and when they find the courage to speak out and report the crime they find that the law only allows them 6 months to report it. Quite often the abuser will go on to assualt another victim. It is time that domestic abuse was recognised as a crime in its own right and the timescale changed to help the frightened and sometimes terrified victims.

attributes.action: Allow the rules of intestacy to be challenged when evidence allows
attributes.background: Allow the rules of intestacy to be challenged where there is evidence that the deceased wishes for their estate to be distributed another way
attributes.additional_details: The rules of intestacy are severely outdated and do not allow for the complex families we have nowadays. They allow for people to inherit when this isn't what the deceased would have wanted or when all evidence points to another method of distribution. The rules should not be as black and white as they are at present.There should be an allowance for people to challenge the rules when necessary.

attributes.action: Place ‘not all disabilities and illnesses are visible’ signs on disabled toilets
attributes.background: Those living with unseen disabilities and invisible illnesses can need; and have the right to use, disabled toilet facilities. Yet current signage is not inclusive, overlooks and marginalises those who need to use them, but have no outward or visible indicators of their needs.
attributes.additional_details: The current signage on disabled toilets does not represent our current understanding of hidden disabilities and invisible illnesses; by updating signage on all pre-existing, and all new build disabled toilets we can improve the quality of life for thousands of people around the U.K.  By adding this new signage alongside the pre-existing wheelchair emblem, we both include those living with hidden disabilities and invisible illnesses, and promote equality of toilet access across wider society.

attributes.action: Change the law for protection for Police Service Animals
attributes.background: The current MAXIMUM sentence for injuring a Police Service Animal is 6 months, but it is usually just a fine. Help to change the Animal Welfare Act 2006 to carry a heavier sentence and to take all Police Service Animals into consideration.

attributes.action: Add ethnic groups Gypsies, Roma and Irish Travellers to the NHS data dictionary
attributes.background:
Gypsies, Roma and Irish Travellers are ethnic groups with some of the lowest health outcomes in the UK.

At present, these groups are not recorded in the NHS data dictionary. Inclusion in the NHS data dictionary would give a clearer idea to authorities on how to tackle these health inequalities.
attributes.additional_details:
Gypsies and Travellers have a life expectancy of over 10% less than the general population (10-12 years). Other health issues include such as high infant mortality rates, high maternal mortality rates are also seen to be prevalent in the Gypsy and Traveller communities. 

Furthermore, the European Commission sees similar health inequalities with Roma; “a high prevalence of diabetes, cardiovascular disease...obesity, asthma and mental health issues such as stress, anxiety and depression”

attributes.action: After the reign of Queen Elizabeth, hold referendum on abolition of royal family
attributes.background: Too expensive to have monarch. Majority of the time monarch does not exercise powers. Feudal system outdated. Britain needs change to more modern and democratic society.
attributes.additional_details: The monarch serves no political purpose. Britain claims to be a democracy - democracy is based on equality, not class hierarchy.

attributes.action: UK Government should urge India to stop mob lynching and crime against women.
attributes.background: UK Government should ask India to stop mob lynching and stop crime against women in India and take action against Saffron Terrorists who are killing minorities including Muslims and Christians.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Government should ask United Nations Commission on Human Rights to take notice of what is happening in India.

86% of those killed in cow-related violence since 2010 are Muslim, 97% attacks after Modi govt came to power-https://m.hindustantimes.com/india-news/86-killed-in-cow-related-violence-since-2010-are-muslims-97-attacks-after-modi-govt-came-to-power/story-w9CYOksvgk9joGSSaXgp”

attributes.action: Residents of Thanet to engage with the Secretary of State and Thanet District Co
attributes.background: To enable the residents of Thanet to engage with the Secretary of State and Thanet District Council, to make clear their views on the objectives for the proposed Thanet plan.
attributes.additional_details:
Thanet District Council at a meeting the other week rejected the Local Plan .
So the Secretary of State said he will be getting involved. 
We the Residents would like to put our views over to the Secretary of State and our reservation on the numbers talked about

attributes.action: Make it illegal to cut grass verges at night-time as it kills nocturnal wildlife
attributes.background: The Council have started to cut grass verges at night-time. This is disastrous for nocturnal wildlife eg hedgehog's, vole's etc as they come out onto the grass verges to feed and travel and are too slow to avoid the mower blades. These animals need protecting and it should be done during the day.

attributes.action: Means test Prisoners to pay for their care in Prison.
attributes.background: There are Prisoners who have personal assets i.e. properties and bank accounts that should be used to pay for their care, just as those within society have to pay for their care in old age

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into the decision to incentivise diesel cars & its effects
attributes.background: In 2001 the government decided to link car tax (VED) to CO2 emissions. In 2002 company car tax also became emissions-based. People were encouraged by such incentives to buy diesel cars. Health-damaging air pollution has worsened dramatically and diesel car owners now face punitive charges.
attributes.additional_details:
Two very serious effects of this decision fully justify a public inquiry, to ensure such grave policy mistakes aren't repeated and to consider public compensation:

1. Air pollution now causes 40,000 early deaths in the UK and costs the country £27.5bn a year, according to the government's own estimates. MPs have called this a "public health emergency".

2. People encouraged to buy diesel cars now face punitive costs and barriers to their use. This reversal is grievous public maladministration.

attributes.action: Set a legal minimum requirement for hamster cages
attributes.background: RSPCA recommend that a Syrian Hamster should have a cage with 80 x 50cm unbroken floor space. However this is not defined in law so pet shops can sell 50 x 60cm cages as LARGE hamster cages. Your small pets live stressed and unhappy lives, while you think you’ve bought a sufficient cage.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should change the law so that it specifically includes this minimum cage size for hamsters. This would make it an offence to sell and use cages for hamsters which don’t meet this size.

attributes.action: Lower the age for bowel screening in England to 55.
attributes.background: Last year, I lost my role model, my best friend, and my dad. He was diagnosed with Stage 4 bowel cancer with secondary mets to his liver and lymph nodes. He was just 58 years old, had just become a grandad for the first time and had the rest of his life to live.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, the NHS provides bowel screening every 2 years from the age of 60, although evidence from Cancer Research UK shows that between 2012-2014 age-specific incidence rates of bowel cancer rise steeply from around age 50-54. The diagnosis rates are also much higher for men. The current survival rate for stage 4 bowel cancer in men is just 5% compared to stage 3 which is 65%. I truly believe that if the screening age was lowered to 55, that there would be a better chance of survival.

attributes.action: Paramedic students with a first degree to get government student loans.
attributes.background:
NHS funding has stopped this year for Paramedics. It is now a self funded course. Paramedics are an Allied Health Care Profession. 
However unlike other health care professions you cannot get government student finance to cover your course fees, if you have a first degree.
attributes.additional_details:
People affected by this inequality of funding, have been offered university places to study on the grounds that they have the life and education to study and be excellent paramedics. 
However, unlike other allied health care professions paramedic students can not get funding if they have a degree already. If you want to study other health care professions you can get funding. This is very unfair. These students are often making sacrifices and life changes. It is being made almost impossible for us to study as paramedics. We want the same equality as others wanting to study a health care profession. 
We have unsuccessfully asked the University minister, Health and Education ministers to look into this. 
Nothing has changed. 
We have not had a good reason for this inequality.
